strings.MSG_ABOUT: Google Calendar Gadget V2.0 © 2007 Google Use this plugin to easily see a month at a glance, and manage events on your Google Calendar.
strings.MSG_SIGN_IN: Sign in with your Google Account
strings.emailIsBlank: Please enter a valid Google account email address!
strings.errorBadAuthText: Username and password do not match
strings.errorBadAuthSnippet: Please confirm your Google account username and password under Options
strings.errorUnknownSnippet: There seems to be a problem with your Google account. You will need to login to Google Calendar using your browser first. After that, you may use this gadget to view your calendar.
strings.errorCaptchaRequiredSnippet: Click on the title of this message to login to your Google account. Because of too many incorrect password attempts, you will need to login using your browser first. After that, you may use this gadget to view your calendar.
strings.errorServiceUnavailableSnippet: The Google Calendar service is temporarily unavailable. This gadget will automatically try again later to show your calendar.
strings.MSG_QUICKADD: Quick Add: e.g., Dinner with Michael 7pm tomorrow
strings.MSG_GETTING_STARTED_1: To see events from Google Calendar
strings.MSG_NO_ACCOUNT: You can use Google Calendar to keep track of all your events, and share with friends and family.
strings.MSG_NO_ACCOUNT_LOGIN: To sign in, click the down-arrow in this module and then select options
strings.enterUsernamePasswordText: Click on the downward-arrow, then Options
strings.gettingStartedSnippet: To get load events from Google Calendar, click the downward-arrow next to the time, and select options from the menu. Enter your Google account username and password, and this gadget will start displaying your calendar.
strings.errorOccuredDescText: There was an unexpected error retrieving your calendar.
strings.unexpectedErrorText: There was an unexpected error retrieving your calendar. We apologize and request you to send us more information about this error, so we can fix it in the next release or forward them to the Google Calendar team.
